meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of ribonucleic acid (RNA) into smaller components.
meanings.sent1: The ribonuclease helped break down the RNA into smaller parts.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use ribonuclease to study how RNA is broken down in cells.
meanings.sent3: The ribonuclease was so efficient that the RNA molecules didn't stand a chance!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a ribonuclease, breaking down any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The ribonuclease worked tirelessly, like a tiny molecular superhero, dismantling the RNA molecules.

meanings.definition: A protein that breaks down RNA molecules by cleaving phosphodiester bonds.
meanings.sent1: The ribonuclease cleaved the bonds in the RNA, breaking it down.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, researchers use ribonuclease to study how RNA is broken apart.
meanings.sent3: The ribonuclease was like a molecular scissors, snipping away at the RNA bonds.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a ribonuclease, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The ribonuclease worked diligently, like a tiny molecular gardener pruning the RNA bonds.

meanings.definition: A biological catalyst that aids in the degradation of RNA in cells.
meanings.sent1: The ribonuclease played a crucial role in breaking down RNA within the cells.
meanings.sent2: Cells rely on ribonuclease to help with the breakdown of RNA molecules.
meanings.sent3: The ribonuclease was like a helpful janitor, cleaning up the RNA mess in the cells.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as a ribonuclease, aiding in the breakdown of barriers between people.
meanings.sent5: The ribonuclease worked quietly, like a gentle biological assistant, assisting in the degradation of RNA.
